intro: Carmichaelia angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Carmichaelia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, adapting to the cool, moist environments where it thrives. Carmichaelia angustata is often found in forest margins and rocky areas, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
